questions.text: Death of a person occurred due to multiple bullets hitting the head. Skull and brain are shattered, brain is coming out. There is no injury on any other body part. What is true for autopsy?

options.label: A
options.text: Autopsy not needed as the cause of death is clear

options.label: B
options.text: Only cranial cavity to be opened

options.label: C
options.text: Cranial and chest cavity to be opened.

options.label: D
options.text: Cranial, chest, abdominal, all to be opened

questions.correct_answer: D. Cranial, chest, abdominal, all to be opened
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Cranial, chest, abdominal, all to be opened

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Forensic autopsies should always be conducted in a thorough and complete manner, including the examination of cranial, thoracic, and abdominal cavities, even when the cause of death appears obvious. This is essential to ensure accuracy in identifying the cause and manner of death

questions.text: A cab driver visits the doctor for burning micturition. On through evaluation, a diagnosis of a sexually transmitted disease is made. Doctors informs this to his employer without his consent. Divulgence of professional secrecy to employer is allowed in this case under which concept?

options.label: D
options.text: Should not have been divulged to the employer

questions.correct_answer: D. Should not have been divulged to the employer
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Should not have been divulged to the employer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Patient confidentiality is a fundamental principle in medical ethics. Health information, such as a diagnosis of an STD, must not be disclosed to third parties, including employers, without the patient’s consent unless there are exceptional circumstances that justify breaching confidentiality (e.g., public health concerns or legal obligations).

questions.text: A medical officer is urgently called to attend to a patient with critical injuries from a hit-and-run accident. As the patient's condition deteriorates rapidly, the medical officer realizes the importance of recording the patient's account of the incident, suspecting it might be the patient's dying declaration. Which of the following actions aligns best with the protocol for recording a dying declaration in India?

options.label: A
options.text: The medical officer must wait for the presence of the accused and their lawyer before recording the patient's statement.

options.label: B
options.text: The medical officer can record the patient's statement only if the magistrate is present.

options.label: C
options.text: The medical officer is allowed to ask leading questions to quickly gather all necessary information from the patient.

options.label: D
options.text: If the patient unexpectedly recovers, the recorded statement will lose its value

questions.correct_answer: D. If the patient unexpectedly recovers, the recorded statement will lose its value
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) If the patient unexpectedly recovers, the recorded statement will lose its value

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A dying declaration can be recorded by any responsible individual, including a medical officer, in urgent circumstances. Leading questions should be avoided, and if the patient recovers, the statement may still hold limited corroborative value in court. The focus should always be on capturing the patient's statement promptly and accurately without waiting for formalities or legal representatives.

questions.text: Number of temporary teeth at 5 years:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 20

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ At 5 years of age, a child will typically have all 20 temporary (deciduous) teeth. The shedding of temporary teeth and the eruption of permanent teeth generally begins around age 6.

questions.text: A patient is brought into the emergency room after a severe car accident. The patient is unconscious and in critical condition, with multiple injuries. In this situation, the healthcare team may need to perform various surgical procedures, such as: Emergency surgery to stop internal bleeding. Orthopedic surgery to repair broken bones. Neurosurgery to relieve pressure on the brain. Plastic surgery to address facial injuries. Thoracic surgery to treat lung injuries. Given the urgency of the situation and the patient's inability to provide specific consent, the healthcare team may ask a family member for consent to perform any necessary surgeries to stabilize and treat the patient's injuries, without giving details on specific type of surgery. This is a type of?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Blanket consent

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blanket consent refers to permission given by the patient’s family or representative to perform any necessary medical procedures in an emergency, without specifying each surgery or treatment in detail. This type of consent allows healthcare professionals to provide lifesaving care in urgent situations where detailed informed consent is not feasible.
  • ➤ Blanket consent

questions.text: A skull was recovered from a forest. According to inquest papers, woman had gone missing after a fight with her boyfriend a month back. The skull was sent to the forensic research lab. Which of the following would identify it as a female skull?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Large and round orbits

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ One of the distinguishing features of female skulls is the presence of large, round orbits. These characteristics, along with other skeletal features, can be used to determine the sex of an individual in forensic analysis.

questions.text: Identify the true statement about the image given below?

options.label: B
options.text: Due to sulphemoglobin accumulation and formation

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with a case of electrical burns

questions.correct_answer: B. Due to sulphemoglobin accumulation and formation
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Due to sulphemoglobin accumulation and formation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Marbling is a postmortem change caused by bacterial decomposition of blood in veins, resulting in the formation of sulphemoglobin, and it typically becomes prominent around 36 hours after death.

questions.text: Identify the gestational age of the fetus if the Crown Rump Length is 21 cm. Both testes are seen near the external inguinal ring. The gestational age of the fetus will be:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 7 months

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ At 7 months of gestation , both testes are typically positioned near the external inguinal ring . The Crown Rump Length (CRL) of 21 cm further confirms a gestational age of approximately 7 months.
  • ➤ 7 months of gestation
  • ➤ external inguinal ring

questions.text: Fish tailing is seen in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Stab wound

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fish tailing is a distinctive feature of single-edged stab wounds . It refers to the appearance at the edges of the wound, with one clean-cut side and one irregular side, indicative of the knife's withdrawal from the body.
  • ➤ Fish tailing
  • ➤ single-edged stab wounds

questions.text: False -ve hydrostatic test in live born fetus is for:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Atelectasis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A false negative hydrostatic test occurs when respiration has taken place, but the lungs still sink in water due to conditions like atelectasis , where the lungs collapse and no air remains within them
  • ➤ false negative hydrostatic test
  • ➤ atelectasis

questions.text: In gunshot injury to skull with entry wound at right temporal region surrounded by abrasion collar & tattooing and an exit wound at left temporal region along with metal fragments of bullet inside the bullet track what can be used to determine the range of firing?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Hair

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of gunshot wounds to the skull, hair can be used to determine the range of fire, as it can exhibit signs of singeing or burning due to close-range shots. This helps forensic experts assess the distance from which the firearm was discharged
  • ➤ hair
  • ➤ singeing or burning

questions.text: Identify the true statement from the following about battered baby syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Skull Fractures of various ages are seen

options.label: B
options.text: It occurs due to the tendency of a child to fall repeatedly

options.label: C
options.text: Rib fractures are suggestive of battered baby syndrome

options.label: D
options.text: Shot gun wounds are commonly seen

questions.correct_answer: C. Rib fractures are suggestive of battered baby syndrome
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Rib fractures are suggestive of battered baby syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rib fractures and metaphyseal fractures of long bones are highly suggestive of battered baby syndrome , which involves non-accidental trauma to children. These types of injuries, particularly when found in varying stages of healing, are key indicators of child abuse.
  • ➤ Rib fractures
  • ➤ metaphyseal fractures
  • ➤ battered baby syndrome

questions.text: A person was found dead on road side. On examination there was cyanosis of the nails, scratches over face, neck and chin, and laceration near lips. Which of the following is not probable true in this case?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Case of a suicide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Suicide by throttling is not plausible because a person would lose consciousness before being able to sustain the pressure needed to fatally strangle themselves. Defensive injuries, such as scratches, strongly suggest homicide , and the signs of asphyxia further indicate strangulation or smothering as the cause of death.
  • ➤ Suicide by throttling
  • ➤ homicide
  • ➤ asphyxia

questions.text: A 13-year-old girl was raped by her neighbor. She presents to the hospital with 25 weeks of pregnancy. What should not be done?

options.label: A
options.text: Examination by Male doctor with female attendant

options.label: B
options.text: Vaginal swab examination is not necessary

options.label: D
options.text: Termination of pregnancy with her consent by a Gynecologist

questions.correct_answer: D. Termination of pregnancy with her consent by a Gynecologist
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Termination of pregnancy with her consent by a Gynecologist

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Understanding legal and medical restrictions on abortion in India: Medical students should be aware of the specific laws and regulations regarding termination of pregnancy in India, including age restrictions and gestational limits. The importance of consent in medical procedures: Consent is a fundamental principle in healthcare. Students should understand the concept of informed consent and its significance in obtaining agreement for medical interventions, especially in vulnerable populations like minors. The role of diagnostic tools in forensic medicine: Ultrasound is a valuable tool for confirming pregnancy and assessing fetal development in forensic cases. Students should be familiar with the appropriate use of diagnostic techniques in investigating sexual assault and related crimes.
  • ➤ Understanding legal and medical restrictions on abortion in India: Medical students should be aware of the specific laws and regulations regarding termination of pregnancy in India, including age restrictions and gestational limits.
  • ➤ Understanding legal and medical restrictions on abortion in India:
  • ➤ The importance of consent in medical procedures: Consent is a fundamental principle in healthcare. Students should understand the concept of informed consent and its significance in obtaining agreement for medical interventions, especially in vulnerable populations like minors.
  • ➤ The importance of consent in medical procedures:
  • ➤ The role of diagnostic tools in forensic medicine: Ultrasound is a valuable tool for confirming pregnancy and assessing fetal development in forensic cases. Students should be familiar with the appropriate use of diagnostic techniques in investigating sexual assault and related crimes.
  • ➤ The role of diagnostic tools in forensic medicine:

questions.text: Pugilistic attitude is due to:

options.label: A
options.text: Intense heat when body temperature is > 65° C

questions.correct_answer: A. Intense heat when body temperature is > 65° C
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Intense heat when body temperature is > 65° C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pugilistic attitude is a characteristic posture of bodies exposed to intense heat, caused by protein coagulation due to temperatures above 65°C . This heat-induced muscle contraction is unrelated to ATP depletion and occurs rapidly in response to fire or extreme heat exposure.
  • ➤ Pugilistic attitude
  • ➤ protein coagulation
  • ➤ 65°C

questions.text: Characteristic of Joule burn include all except?

options.label: C
options.text: Pale raised skin at the margins

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Joule burn is Hyperaemic

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Joule burns are typically pale with minimal hyperemia due to vasospasm caused by the intense heat of electrical contact. These burns are often seen at the point of contact with the electrical source and may form a shallow crater with raised pale margins .
  • ➤ Joule burns
  • ➤ pale
  • ➤ vasospasm
  • ➤ point of contact
  • ➤ shallow crater
  • ➤ raised pale margins

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman accuses her office colleague of spiking her drink and raping her. Which test can be used to detect vaginal cells on a person who is accused of rape?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Lugol's test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Lugol's iodine test is a key method used to identify vaginal cells in forensic cases. It detects glycogen-containing vaginal epithelial cells, which can be crucial evidence in sexual assault investigations.
  • ➤ Lugol's iodine test

questions.text: A man who was involved in a bomb blast at a railway station was brought to the hospital with rupture of tympanic membrane. Which of the following mechanisms is responsible for these injuries?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) High pressure wave

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary blast injuries result from the high pressure wave of an explosion and mainly affect hollow organs , with tympanic membrane rupture being one of the most common manifestations.
  • ➤ Primary blast injuries
  • ➤ high pressure wave
  • ➤ hollow organs
  • ➤ Blast Injury Types And Mechanisms
  • ➤ Blast Injury Types And Mechanisms

questions.text: A 20-year-old unmarried girl was brought to the OPD. Genital examination revealed the findings as given below. Labia majora - separated Labia minora- flabby Old ruptured hymen Deep, roomy, dilated and capacious with less rugosed wall What is true about this girl from the options below?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Not a virgin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The primary fact to memorize is that an old ruptured hymen, flabby labia minora, and a deep, capacious vagina with less rugosed walls are indicative of habitual sexual activity. These findings help differentiate between virginity and non-virginity in forensic medical examinations. However, it is important to note that past sexual behavior should not be reported in rape cases as per legal and ethical guidelines.

questions.text: A 13-year-old girl, is brought by a lady police sub-inspector to the doctor, alleging a history of sexual violence that occurred in the morning same day. Which statement is incorrect as the next course of action by the doctor?

options.label: C
options.text: Consent of a legal guardian is not mandatory to give the medical treatment for injuries to the victim.

options.label: D
options.text: Consent of victim is sufficient, and that of legal guardian is not required for MTP if the girl is found to be pregnant at a later stage

questions.correct_answer: D. Consent of victim is sufficient, and that of legal guardian is not required for MTP if the girl is found to be pregnant at a later stage
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Consent of victim is sufficient, and that of legal guardian is not required for MTP if the girl is found to be pregnant at a later stage

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For minors (under 18 years), the consent of a legal guardian is mandatory for procedures such as the Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP), but for emergency medical treatment of injuries, the consent of the child over 12 years old may suffice. Additionally, in cases of sexual assault, it is essential to take a detailed history and preserve all physical evidence, including clothing.

questions.text: A patient was brought to casualty with seizures. He had multiple episodes and was taking herbal medicines for the same. He was conscious in between the episodes. During the episodes, he had arching of his back. What is the likely cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Strychnine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Strychnine poisoning is characterized by severe, repetitive muscle spasms and opisthotonos (arching of the back). A key diagnostic feature is that the patient remains conscious between seizures. Recognizing these symptoms is crucial in diagnosing and managing strychnine poisoning effectively.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman is brought to the hospital by emergency medical services after being found unconscious in a park. She is unresponsive to verbal stimuli and is breathing very shallowly. Friends who were with her mention that she had been using drugs at a party earlier. Her breathing rate is 6 breaths per minute, and her pupils are constricted. Her skin is pale, and she feels cool to the touch. Which of the following substances is most likely responsible for her presentation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Opioid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Opioid overdose presents with respiratory depression, unconsciousness, and pinpoint pupils. Recognizing these signs is critical for immediate intervention, often requiring the administration of naloxone (an opioid antagonist) to reverse the life-threatening effects. Understanding the typical presentations of various substances, such as CNS depressants (opioids, alcohol) versus stimulants (cocaine, methamphetamine), is essential for proper diagnosis and treatment in emergency settings.

questions.text: 18-year woman is having agitation, hallucinations, and nystagmus. She is also exhibiting muscle rigidity & occasional catatonic posturing. Likely cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Phencyclidine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phencyclidine (PCP) is a dissociative hallucinogen that acts as an NMDA receptor antagonist. It is characterized by agitation, hallucinations, nystagmus , muscle rigidity , catatonia , and dissociation. These features distinguish it from other stimulants and hallucinogens such as amphetamines, cocaine, and LSD. Recognizing these key symptoms is critical in diagnosing PCP intoxication.
  • ➤ nystagmus
  • ➤ muscle rigidity
  • ➤ catatonia

questions.text: All of the following substances bind well to activated charcoal except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cyanide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Activated charcoal is ineffective in binding substances like cyanide , metals, alcohols, hydrocarbons, corrosives, and certain other chemicals (as represented by the mnemonic "M-O-H-A-C"). For effective use of activated charcoal, the toxin must be one that binds well to it, such as drugs like thioridazine, atenolol, and THC. Recognizing the limitations of activated charcoal is crucial in managing poisoning cases.
  • ➤ cyanide

questions.text: A 25-year-old industrial worker was found dead at work place. He was working in a confined space near a decaying organic material storage facility for several hours since morning. Likely cause?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Methane

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methane is commonly released in confined spaces with decaying organic matter and can cause asphyxia when it displaces oxygen. In such cases, workers in confined spaces should be cautious of oxygen displacement and methane accumulation. Understanding the toxic effects of different gases in specific environments is crucial in forensic medicine.
